roleset.name: split into smaller parts
roleset.note: FISSION-V, FISSION-N NOTES: Added by Julia for clearearth-biotexts.

example.name: fission-v
example.text: Typically, a large nucleus like that of uranium fissions by splitting into two smaller nuclei, along with a few neutrons, the release of heat energy (kinetic energy of the nuclei), and gamma rays.
example.arg: a large nucleus like that of uranium
by splitting into two smaller nuclei, along with a few neutrons, the release of heat energy (kinetic energy of the nuclei), and gamma rays

example.name: fission-n
example.text: Nuclear fission of heavy elements was discovered on December 17, 1938 by German Otto Hahn and his assistant Fritz Strassmann, and explained theoretically in January 1939 by Lise Meitner and her nephew Otto Robert Frisch. Frisch named the process by analogy with biological fission of living cells.

example.name: fission-n
example.text: Frisch named the process by analogy with biological fission of living cells.

example.name: fission-n
example.text: We investigate the collinear ternary fission of the 260No isotope.

example.name: fission-n
example.text: Haptophrya gigantea is resolved by repeated binary fission into a chain of eight individuals.
example.arg: into a chain of eight individuals
